item.title: FIVE tips for beginners?
item.dc:creator: Pinewoodog
item.description:
MY ARGUMENT: These are tips for beginners. By no means should anybody who has been making music for over a month follow these tips.

Produk:

People want to listen to quality music, not cheap, poorly made music

At the start, very few people actually are listening to your music. No matter how much time a beginner spends on a project, there‚Äôs a limit to how good it can get. At some point, it‚Äôs just wasting time.

Produk:

Details are what make or break a song. Don‚Äôt ignore them.

Beginners need to focus on the main content of their songs before they can look at the details. I didn‚Äôt say that you shouldn‚Äôt put reverb on your song- I just said that‚Äôs not a priority compared to actually knowing how to make a song.

Also, in the beginning, everybody is going to have a lot of ‚Äúbroken‚Äù songs. Then they learn from their mistakes. I don‚Äôt know anybody who made a super duper amazing song with every detail just right on their first or even second try.

Produk:

literally numbers 1 and 2 again

Produk:

Spend lots of time on your tracks
know music theory(at least know how to make chords)
don‚Äôt be afraid to ask questions

item.title: FIVE tips for beginners?
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
Dear Auxy Community

I‚Äôm no professional in any way, shape or form‚Ä¶
However, here are some tips from other artists that have helped me: And I hope that they may help some of you in the future.

  1. Make music that You like. Don‚Äôt try to copy trends or try and make something everyone else is making just to get some attention. Just focus on making a sound that you like listening to!

  2. Fantom 87 once told me to ‚ÄúTry to always finish songs even if you think they aren‚Äôt good. It‚Äôs a good habit to have.‚Äù This has tremendously helped me. Finishing tracks instead of just deleting them or starting over has helped me to practice, to experiment with sounds, and to work on enhancing low quality loops, chords, melodies, etc.

  3. Work on chords! To me, chords are a pain in the butt! However, its important to always try to implement chords into your track, it makes it sound wayyy better! With chords, just start simple, maybe 2-3 note chords, then keep on extending them, and adding to them. And eventually you will end up with a couple amazing 8-bar chords!!! Just take your time!

  4. Try recreating a track from scratch. If you finish a track you really love, but you feel like there is something missing, try starting a new project, and remake it from scratch! (Please don‚Äôt delete the original ) Without looking back to the original file, try remaking drums, chords, and melodies! You will be able to create a new and hopefully better track. (And if it doesn‚Äôt work for you, you can always just head back to the original project lol)

  5. Take a break. Try not to stick to your tablet/phone all day. If you find a block in inspiration, just relax! Soundcloud and Auxy is allways going to be there

P.S Go to a park or somewhere pretty and try making music there! Its super fun!

Well, I hope these random tips can help at least one of you producers out there!

Love,
Daniel

item.title: FIVE tips for beginners?
item.dc:creator: Pinewoodog
item.description:
My tips:

  1. Finish as many tracks as you can as fast as you can. In the beginning, you‚Äôre going to have a lot of inspiration, and it can be discouraging spending weeks on a track only to realize that the stuff you did weeks ago was trash. Creating new songs rapidly will help you learn new tricks, even though in the end only a select few of those should be published.

  2. Don‚Äôt get caught up in the details. You can read as many books on mixing or mastering as you want, but the real way to learn this stuff is to create. Going back to tip one; just make it! Otherwise you‚Äôll just be disappointed later on by a track you spent months on.

  3. Listen to the kind of music you want to produce. Nobody can create a future bass song if they‚Äôve never heard one in their life. So if you‚Äôre looking to make dubstep, listen to a lot of dubstep. That way, you‚Äôll be getting more inspiration for your tracks. Also, don‚Äôt make the mistake of choosing something weird. If you like listening to trap and only listen to trap, then make trap. Chances are, your trap song is going to turn out better than your house song.

  4. Don‚Äôt obsess over details or waste time. I can‚Äôt tell you how many hours I spent searching the internet for free plugins that I never used. Try to make do with what you have. Sometimes, that can lead to even more creativity.

  5. Don‚Äôt give up. If you‚Äôre sad because your music isn‚Äôt up to par with other producers, just keep on going. You‚Äôre constantly getting better. The only thing that can stop you from getting better is yourself. And if you never stop, well then, you‚Äôll achieve your goals.
